comments.body: I know that mod! it's great, i also think they could add something like that, or digging too deep allows us to get to the nether, that makes sense, I hope one day they add it, and that this is all optional, when creating the world.
Please consider adding this - immersive portals mod is super fun :)
Oh ya it is truly fantastic I've been waiting a long time for this in bedrock. Just give us this small update. :)
Maybe like Soul Lava?
United soil yes... but there is lava in nether now... so i think the nether water is more particular, however it's a good idea.
Soul lava is a good name
Also maybe a new mob spawns on river edge
pineapples

With one block of quartz in the middle and obsidian
around.
This sounds a lot like the ather dimension that WILL BE PUT IN IN 1.18

Yes!!!!

Beaches and ready built houses :)
You said nothing about the ather I would add a lot more detail!

who said were getting aether i didnt see that anyways 1.17 is the cave update i think its safe to assume 1,18 is gonna be the end update ,so we wont be getting the aether update until at least 1,19 assuming thats what they do i personally think they would add the moon before the aether
I like it but add more details please
Sulfur whale will be 3 blocks wide and 2 blocks high, please vote for this post and leave a comment

well i think it would be cool if they had a new yellow  stone in the biome and blue lava like in that sulfer volcanoe in india also maybe if you pour water on the acid it explodes but also dissapears but it damages blocks around it

First one!!!

7w7
That would be super annoying.

While it could be annoying, it would be a neat hint for the untold lore and be sense making, since soul sand and soul soil are made with souls and it can mean that some of those could flee to hunt you down as vexes.
Kind of like below the bedrock in Minecraft story mode?

Good idea, I was about to tell the Minecraft team that but found you already decided on this. 

Netherite seems like the tool required but anything, as long as a world under the bedrock is made
I think this should go hand to hand with what they showed in Minecraft Story Mode Season 2 where they actually did go beyond the bedrock
This is an officially rejected suggestion, I think. (Previously considered suggestions)
I think this would be awesome, especially if there was a way you could walk on the clouds. If there was some kind of "Cloud Walker" enchantment or item, that would honestly be really cool.
That is a great idea, doge! Then they would be good for when your elytra breaks!
I think this is a fantastic idea! It could be added to your gear the same way as netherite, and give each item a unique twist! It would be a rare and powerful endgame feature! I like it!
I love your idea, it's cute and refreshing and would be wonderful to stumble across in a survival aspect
Maybe you could milk the flower with a glass bottle for a bottle of luminesce which can act as a potion that gives you light to or a time.
I think that at different times the waves would be heavy, light or calm. it would be a particle effect that pushes you back to the shore.

May-b Mojang could add a Barn building at the center of the field with humanoids called Pumpkinheads that live in them and wear Pumpkins on their heads. unlike Snow Golems they can’t take their pumpkins off. They’d b neutral humanoids equipped with wooden Hoes and swords, and leather armor. There’d b between 3-8 pumpkinheads per barn and at night go 2 bed. U could buy things like pumpkin pie, pumpkin seeds, eggs, and sugar. They’d only spawn in Savannah, Plains, and snow biomes
Also, you should be able to carve the new pumpkins in many different ways.

А что это за измерение бесконечное интересно! Правда любое измерение будет с границей мира хотя разработчики могут сделать его и без границы (это измерение)! Хотя что это за изменение такое немного не понятно!
i mean like if you put a signed book into nether portal it makes a new dimension
I really would find that so fun
I love the idea of that.
I I think that will be a good idea because it would be much more fair for bedrock to have infinite dimensions.
They should put it as a free add-on, like they did with the poison potatoes one. I know it was years ago, but i'd like it

I really like this idea. I feel like the grinding enchantment should only give 30% more exp at level three. Maybe the new mob could be like a Nether specter or a magma golem or even Mob D. This could even lead to a new enchantment for the helmet that would allow the player to survive see further in the mist. All things considered, I really like your idea and it would be a great addition to Minecraft.
Thank you.
maybe even ancient elytra that allow you to fly up in survival
I think this is too op for the overworld but would fit nicely in another dimension.
The technology should be represented by enchantments.
Could be the origin of ancient debris.
Great idea! I really want the end to be updated, so let's get some support for end related feedback!

I was just thinking about something like this recently. An Ender Junkyard: a dark biome with blocks scattered around in jagged, imposing hills. Endermites lurking in the crevasses waiting for an unsuspecting victim. I’d love a biome like this that gives some background to the Endermen while remaining mysterious and giving off an ominous vibe.

I like this idea. Perhaps instead of snowy mountains, such caves would generate instead in swamps and jungles, being that they are warmer, promoting moss growth. There could also be different mobs as well, such as skeletons and zombies with a more decayed, mossy appearance. 

Instead of a grass variant, perhaps moss could grow on top and on the sides of blocks, like a carpet that could be placed on walls and ceilings.

I quite like this idea. I agree this would be cool, and would serve both functional and aesthetic purposes. On the whole i like it, but I don't really think it has the potential to make it into the game.

6/10
How about giving a more moist/wet posing noise to the moss blocks ?
This seems interesting so I would like to get more details like what it would be made of and what it would be like overall (difficulty, mobs, etc.) seems like a cool idea.

The exact biome(s) of this dimension could be anything.  The dimension rather than the biome is more important as an idea to me.

 

However if I were to pick something I'd perhaps go with something very dark.  Perhaps with a MAXimum light level of something very low.  Torches and such would have little or no effect.  Higher difficulty level overall compared to Nether.  Minus the lava.  Difficulty would be in the mobs rather than the environment.  I prefer having to fight my way through rather than tip toeing around to avoid falling into a pit of lava.

If this biome would to be added, it would have to be so hot you couldn't survive without potions are special armor. I like to think of the nether as the "mantle" of the overworld, so this dimension would represent the core, and should have VERY rare, hard to get ores and difficult mobs. Good idea!
Portal blocks: Netherite Blocks

If this gets implemented, the Sub-Nether Portal would have to be of an expensive, late game material. Netherite is the perfect candidate, and a few people have suggested a Soul Stone Flint & Steel, which I think would complement it perfectly.
Netherite seems a bit expensive for portals.  Perhaps crying obsidian, or whatever the new one is called.
I hope you like my idea
I do like your idea.
Good idea! Definite vote
Sounds good if the spawn rate of fossils is also higher in this biome.
The wither piglin could use a normal crossbow and shoot wither tipped arrows, which he could drop like the stray with slowness arrows
that could add some originality to a world. But one question: how would you get there?
It is very very VERY cool!

Mojang has said before that sharks (at least realistic ones) and blood with both not be coming to Minecraft. Also, we don't need a swimming speed boost potion, since Dolphin's Grace already does that.
The water should be tinted red.
I had the same idea! Beat me to it

I think not.

Soul sandstone better to me.

I mean their are two new blocks in the Soulsand Valley; one is a sandy looking block, if you meant that then I doubt it will even be stone. However the stalactite blocks look like stone (albeit needs a little texture work) I do feel like Soulsand-stone would be a name for soulsand. However Mojang always surprises us.

All though it sounds like a dark dimension I think its a great dimension just two questions. When you’re in this dimension do night vision potions work and also what kind of mobs are there? It’s a great idea I love it.

This sounds like a great idea! Maybe, there could also be some sort of special item that you can get in order to see in the shadow Dimension?

What sort of block should the portal be made out of? Maybe glow stone? So that you have to go to the nether before you can go to the shadow dimension?
